content: silent knit s christmas stockings a pattern by annah burnes these christmas stockings hold a very dear place in my heart as a child i would look at my grandmother s mantel at christmas time which had hand-knit fair isle christmas stockings surrounded by bows of pine and giant pine cones and i thought this is what christmas feels like after gigi s passing i learned how to do stranded color work which is one of the few things in knitting that i didn t learn directly from her and decided to surprise my par- ents with their own set of christmas stockings in gigi s honor on their first christmas at highfield their house in new hampshire that is neighbors with and named after the house that my grandparents lived in during my child- hood these stockings were adored by my friends and family on facebook and inspired me to start my company silent knits with its very first product of customizable christmas stockings as my company has grown i no longer offer them but the name has stuck and as i began to write patterns i decided to give a tribute back to the origins of my company and to my grandmother and formally write the pattern without further ado here are silent knits christmas stockings inspired by ruth rozelle supplies to make both his and hers stitches needed two 220yard/100 gram skeins of dk weight knit k purl p knit two together k2tog slip slip knit yarn in stitch stitch markers gauge 1 tapestry needle 20 stitches by 24 row 1 foot of 3/4 wide ribbon in white this is not overly important but will effect overall size a 16 inch us size 6 needle or needle needed to obtain gauge finished dimensions approximately 8 inches wide by 24 inches long white thread and small sewing needle a pair of scissors pattern cast on using long tail method 72 stitches placing marker after 36th stitch this is where the chart will be repeat place a different colored marker at the end of the row and join in the round knit the chart slip the first marker and repeat the chart this will bring you back to that beginning of the round marker knit all 101 row of the chart in this manner or create your own follow- ing directions on page six once all 101 row have been completed do a happy dance then knit 18 stitches place one of the same markers knit 36 removing marker as you pass it and placing it after the 36 stitches knit to end of round the placement of the
